0: Ralston Dodd, 25, was locked up last year after he almost killed Jerrell Holland by stabbing him in the back three times NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Click to share on WhatsApp (Opens in new window) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A KNIFE thug jailed for nine years is free because bungling court staff wrote nine months on prison forms. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ralston Dodd, 25, was locked up last year after he almost killed Jerrell Holland by stabbing him in the back three times. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Dodd stabbed a man three times in the back after a row NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But stunned Jerrell spotted Dodd in North London just weeks ago. An arrest warrant was issued after the court error was revealed — but Dodd has now gone into hiding. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Jerrell’s dad Alex said: “How can this happen?” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Friends of the knife thug say he thought he had won the lottery when a court blunder freed him after a few months. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ralston Dodd, 25, known as Ratty, stabbed Jerrell Holland three times in the back and punctured his lung after a row. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He was handed the stiff sentence for GBH in November for what was described as an “appalling act of violence that nearly cost a man his life”. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But it is believed crown court staff misheard the judge’s sentence and mistakenly filled out prison forms for a nine-month jail term instead. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It meant prison staff wrongly put Dodd back on the streets within months of him being sent down. He feels like he’s won the lottery and all of his Christmases have come at once. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “He’s had to keep his head down in case anyone spots him. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “It’s unbelievable how it’s happened. He has a violent temperament — and now he’s out.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The friend said Dodd even tried to arrange an appointment with a probation officer after his early release. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But they said they had no record of him needing their services as he was not expected to be free until 2026. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It is not known exactly when Dodd was released from HMP Thameside. But criminals are usually freed halfway through their sentence. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Alamy Dodd, known as Ratty, was originally sentenced to nine years in prison NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Dodd is known to have served no more than seven months — because he was seen in his old haunts last month. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Stunned Jerrell saw him in the passenger seat of a car in North London. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Jerrell’s dad Alex, 42, yesterday demanded answers from the police and prison authorities. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He said: “This is an unacceptable blunder by them. He got nine years for stabbing my son three times. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “He could have died. I held my son and thought he was going to die. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “How can this happen without anyone noticing? I can’t imagine they’d let out Peter Sutcliffe early. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Martin Godwin for the Guardian The thug spent seven months at HMP Thameside NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “When my son saw him in a car he thought at first he was seeing a ghost because Ralston should be in jail.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Ministry of Justice issued a ­warrant for Dodd’s arrest after the alleged court bungle came to light. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But Dodd went into hiding and is still at large. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He knifed Jerrell following a gang dispute outside a housing office in Islington. CCTV footage captured Dodd plunging a knife into the 22-year-old as he tried to flee on a bike. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Jerrell was airlifted to Whitechapel Hospital in a critical condition. He has since made a full recovery. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Dodd went on the run but was ­captured weeks later by a specialist police gang squad.
